titleStmt.title: A notable sermo[n] of ye reuerende father Maister Hughe Latemer whiche he preached in ye Shrouds at paules churche in Londo[n], on the. xviii. daye of Ianuary. 1548.
titleStmt.author: Latimer, Hugh, 1485?-1555.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A17900 of text S116839 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 4565). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 46 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 32 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: A notable sermo[n] of ye reuerende father Maister Hughe Latemer whiche he preached in ye Shrouds at paules churche in Londo[n], on the. xviii. daye of Ianuary. 1548.
titleStmt.author: Latimer, Hugh, 1485?-1555.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Ihon Day, dwellynge at Aldersgate, and Wylliam Seres, dwellyng in Peter Colledge. These bokes are to be sold at the new shop by the lytle Conduyte in Chepesyde,

notesStmt.note: Printers' names and addresses from colophon.
Running title reads: The. iiii. sermon of M. Latimer.
This edition has the arms of the Duchess of Suffolk on verso of title page. Probably later than the edition without the Suffolk arms.
Identified as STC 15292a on UMI microfilm reel 103.
Reproductions of the originals in the British Library.
Appears at reel 82 and at reel 103.
